textBox.richText: I’m not going to deny that I am a geek, I need my machine no matter where on earth I am! Lake Minnewanka (One can only guess how to pronounce it) serves as a perfect office location. If anyone can beam me a wireless Internet connection I’d be mighty appreciative. Although Minnewanka is an impressive lake our highlight of the day would have to be ascending all 7800 feet of Sulpher Mountain. Our options were a half a day hike or a 5 minute gondola ride. It’s not hard to guess which option we chose. The views from Sulpher Mountain didn’t disappoint - full 360 views encompassing Banff and many iconic Canadian Rocky mountains. A extremely powerful lighting and thunder storm during the night must have awoken many of Banff’s wildlife. This morning we came across a couple of grizzly’s. Again, luckily we had a couple of thousand tonnes of metal (i.e. our car) between us and them. We just count ourselves lucky we haven’t come across any on our mountain hikes!
